artifact_name: cup type a(possibly); stemless cup(possibly); skyphos(possibly)
Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery type A cup or skyphos; interior: glazed black with traces of two bands in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of lower part of female (only garment and feet remaining) walking to left; at left, part of possible chair; below, black with trace of reserved area at break.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "3" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0639) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
